reviewText: I watched parts of the concert on NBC and VH1 last July and saw plenty of music I liked and remembered- some of the newer, unfamiliar, stuff was pretty good too. I especially liked the video bits, shown between performances, of people who had known the Princess- those were often very interesting.This is a 2 DVD set that has everything broadcast during the concert (and I think more)-it's nicely packaged and set up (you have the option of either listening to it all straight or picking your own mix of singers) shouldn't be too bad (although I just skipped around using the "next" on my remote). The images are very clear and the sound is good but subtitling is provided only for the speaking bits, not the songs themselves (so if you want to sing along or just don't know the lyrics you're out of luck). I remembered seeing the old home movies of Diana at the end- they're here too.There's so much here, so many singers and songs, videos for the Diana fans- this DVD set would be well worth owning for just about anyone, it would even make a good gift- for the same reasons.
summary: Some good music for anyone, a must have for Diana fans- worth having or givingto someone
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had bought this as a gift....I already had received one, and it is a super concert! It opens with a welcome from princes William and Harry,and then follows with some awesome acts like Duran Duran,Fergie,Nelly Furtado, Rod Stewart,Tom Jones, and Joss Stone, to name a few! It also include touching tributes from folks who Diana had touched over the years,prior to her tragic passing. The tributes alone are really fantastic to see...you may shed a tear or two,and to top that with superb artists, well, you can't go wrong!Truly, a must for fans of Diana!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed all the artists who appeared in the concert and am impressed with the two Princes who put it together for the late Princess Diana. I'll be watching this over and over again! I learned more about the princess too! The little films in between the performances was very informative. I really enjoyed the broadway part. I received this DVD in good condition and very promptly! Thank you!

reviewText: A good documentary on Diana's life would have served better.  Going back and forth from concert to clips was too much and made the film longer than it should have been.

reviewText: Amazon dot com is wrong, this is a 2 disc set! I ordered mine from MovieMars and they were fast shipping!My Discs have; The Diana Films, A series of films about the Princess Diana were shown to the crowd at Wembley Stadium and those watching around the world. They were a compelling testimony from people of all ages and walks of life to Diana's remarkable qualities. These Blu-ray disc's include all the films shown at the concert as well as additional films which have never previously been seen!Documentary; This Blu-ray includes a unique documentary about the making of Concert for Diana which never before interviews and backstage footage!The Blu-ray disc's  are Audio Formats; Region All! Aspect Ratio:16:9. Plus the Subtitles are in English, German, Spanish, and Portuguese.Have a Great time watching this Concert for the Late Great Princess Diana! She is the the Queen of our Hearts!!God Bless,K. Ann
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was a historic concert that was seen all over the world - mostly on cable. It's great to have it on DVD with the search function and even option to create a playlist. And, of course, there are the loving short documentaries between the acts. I missed it on TV and was anxious to see the DVd - especially since there are some British performers who are not as well known in the US.Sadly, however, this important occasion is ruined by the Direct or the event. There is not ONE camera shot which lasts more than four seconds! (Doubt me? Watch and count ... "one one thousand, two one thousand, three one thousand.....). Okay maybe in fast rock song but the same holds true, not only in the slow ballads but in the Swan Lake ballet! Yes, four second cutaways! I was getting a headache watching it and wondered why!Yes, you should probably by this for the music - and the tributes (where, thankfully they don't use fast cuts as often... obviously a different director). Look at Live Aid, Live 8 or even the Pop Concert for the Queen (a great DVD on Naxos). None have these quick cuts, which are jarring.I'll let the music stand for itself and the performances and breadth of the music rate five stars. But I had to deduct two stars for the choppiness of the production.Steve Ramm"Anything Phonographic"
summary: A Historic Concert Marred by Inferior Editing
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own more than 40 music titles in blu. This is one of the top 5 for me. Very enjoyable and entertaining. There are so many stars in the concert: Duran Duran, Rod Stewart, Fergie, Andrea Bocelli, Josh Groban, Sarah Brightman, Elton John, Tom Jones, Donny Osmond, Jason Donovan, etc. A pleasant surprise is Roger Hodgson, who was a member of Supertramp and sings Dreamer, The Logical Song, Breakfast In America and Give A Little Bit. Another enjoyment is Take That, whom I found in this blu-ray is a great boy group with great songs. I know this will be my all time favorite. What a great show!
Title: N/A
